{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3329969,"name":"Deniz Tirol","username":"Senyo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/senyo/{size}/237589_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T15:31:54.753Z","cooked":"

We are getting such errors from Pdh. There seems to be nothing wrong with the electronics and all fuses are plugged in. When we went to Regional, we also asked CSA and they said your PDH is broken and gave us a backup. We will go to another Regional and we don’t know how to make it work.

pdherror1760×1014 89.7 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T15:31:54.753Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":110,"reads":199,"readers_count":198,"score":589.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":458246,"topic_slug":"pdh-errors","display_username":"Deniz Tirol","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/9/2/9252cb1f482bb38bddb4f77b693aae0b6cc9ae7d.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61989,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Electrical Lead of '8557', Drive Team"},"post_url":"/t/pdh-errors/458246/1","custom_user_title":"Electrical Lead of '8557', Drive Team","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3330001,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T15:52:32.674Z","cooked":"

“CSA Channel Read” fault simply means the current-sensong hardware failed. The PDH will function perfectly fine, but you wont get any current data reported in your logs for whatever ports are broken. It will not prevent the PDH from functioning, so its not strictly “broken”, and is perfectly usable with that fault.

You can contact REV support for help as well. Theyll have specofic troubleshooting steps you could try, and may even go so far as to replace it (though I can’t speak for them, so nothing I say should be taken as a commitment from them).

Worst-case scenario, spare parts at events should have one that you could swap in for the length of the event, but you’ll need to return it afterwards.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T15:52:32.674Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":174,"readers_count":173,"score":74.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":458246,"topic_slug":"pdh-errors","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/pdh-errors/458246/2","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3330332,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T19:35:24.103Z","cooked":"

We had sticky faults (not clearable with a reset), with the current feedback recently.

Took the 4 screws off the back of the unit, and cleaned the PCB off front and back with a Nylon detail brush. There were visible debris and copper wire strands likely shorting components - and after the cleaning the sticky faults resolved with a reset and its worked since!

They advise against replacing the CSA chip. It takes a fine solder tip and the component is difficult to get. And then didn’t really offer to replace it either themselves.

Yeah, I definitely don’t think its worth trying to repair yourself. I was fairly sure they weren’t offering to, but they’ve surprised me before, so

Jwal:

We had sticky faults (not clearable with a reset), with the current feedback recently.

Took the 4 screws off the back of the unit, and cleaned the PCB off front and back with a Nylon detail brush. There were visible debris and copper wire strands likely shorting components - and after the cleaning the sticky faults resolved with a reset and its worked since!

Thank you we will try

We had a similar issue. We got metal shavings and some wire bits in our PDH and we were experience stickyfaults all over. The LCD also only displayed 12.0 regardless of battery voltage. Buying a new PDH has been a game changer as it appears we were also experiencing premature brownouts due to some of these issues. Probably better to just replace.
